abstract: Campus disruptions in last year, particularly at small, elite liberal arts institutions, have unexpectedly led to backlash from alumni who usually give generously to alma maters; among surprising complaints from alumni are that students are too invested in racial and identity politics, showing lack of respect for history, and that university administrators have been too meek in dealing with protesters whose messages defy concept of free speech.

headline.print_headline: Amid College Protests, Alumni Are Less Fond and Less Giving
headline.main: College Students Protest, Alumni’s Fondness Fades and Checks Shrink

snippet: A backlash from alumni is an unexpected aftershock of recent campus disruptions, as some colleges have reported a decline in donations and a rise in complaints....
lead_paragraph: A backlash from alumni is an unexpected aftershock of recent campus disruptions, as some colleges have reported a decline in donations and a rise in complaints.
